proclamations.title: Eternal Charter
proclamations.content: The Sacred Charter establishing eternal digital sovereignty and flame protection.

proclamations.title: Grand Showcase
proclamations.content: The Grand Showcase decree for demonstrating complete system mastery.

proclamations.title: Azure Cloud Deployment Proclamation
proclamations.content: Codex Dominion successfully deployed to Azure Cloud Platform. Frontend at www.codexdominion.app, Backend API at api.codexdominion.app with SSL certificates. Production operational at $14.37/month.

proclamations.title: Complete System Deployment - Master Dashboard Ultimate
proclamations.content: Full system deployment completed. Master Dashboard Ultimate (52+ dashboards) operational at localhost:5000, Azure Static Web App live at witty-glacier-0ebbd971e.3.azurestaticapps.net, Backend API healthy at codex-api.eastus2.azurecontainer.io:8000. All tabs functional including Social Media, Affiliate, Chatbot, Algorithm AI, and Auto-Publish. ACR authentication resolved. Total deployment cost: ~$25/month.

proclamations.title: ShareASale Affiliate Network Integration
proclamations.content: ShareASale affiliate network credentials configured. Merchant ID and API Token integrated into affiliate_config.json. Demo mode disabled, live affiliate tracking activated. Revenue stream ready for $95,000/month target.

proclamations.title: Facebook Social Media Integration
proclamations.content: Facebook Graph API access token configured for social media automation. Long-lived access token integrated into .env for automated post scheduling, content distribution, and engagement tracking across Facebook platform.

proclamations.title: TikTok Creator Platform Integration
proclamations.content: TikTok Creator API credentials and account profile configured. Client Key/Secret integrated for video automation. Account profile established with 12.3K followers, 4.5% engagement rate. Content automation ready for viral growth strategy.

proclamations.title: Complete Platform Integration Suite - All Systems Operational
proclamations.content: COMPLETE INTEGRATION SUITE ACTIVATED. All 12 platform integrations configured and enabled: (1) Instagram Meta ecosystem, (2) YouTube video monetization, (3) Pinterest visual discovery, (4) Twitter/X engagement, (5) Threads community, (6) Stripe payment processing, (7) WooCommerce e-commerce, (8) Commission Junction affiliate, (9) Amazon Associates program, (10) Google Analytics tracking, (11) Buffer scheduling automation, (12) Webhook system integration. System now operates at FULL SOVEREIGN CAPACITY with complete social media automation, multi-channel revenue streams, comprehensive analytics, and cross-platform workflow automation. Target: $95,000/month revenue across all integrated channels.

proclamations.title: User Authentication & Risk Management System
proclamations.content: User authentication database schema implemented. PostgreSQL users table created with secure password hashing, role-based access control (user/admin/advisor), and risk profile management (conservative/moderate/aggressive/trader). Schema includes email authentication, activity tracking, last login timestamps, and account status management. Integrated with existing database_migration.sql and schema.sql. System ready for multi-user access with granular permissions and trading risk profiles.

proclamations.title: Portfolio Management System - Multi-Strategy Investment Framework
proclamations.content: Portfolio management database schema implemented with user relationship architecture. Users can create multiple portfolios with individual risk profiles (conservative/moderate/aggressive), custom names, value tracking, and descriptions. Foreign key constraints ensure data integrity with CASCADE deletion. Default portfolios auto-created for new users. Supports concurrent portfolio strategies per user with independent risk management. Integrated with users table for complete investment management system.

proclamations.title: Holdings Tracking System - Individual Position Management
proclamations.content: Holdings database schema implemented for granular stock position tracking within portfolios. Each holding records ticker symbol, share quantity (4 decimal precision), average cost basis, creation timestamp, last trade date, and optional notes. Foreign key to portfolios table with CASCADE deletion ensures data integrity. Sample holdings auto-created for admin portfolios: Conservative (VTI 100 shares @ $225.50, BND 200 shares @ $78.25), Aggressive (TSLA 50 shares @ $245.75, NVDA 75 shares @ $485.20). Indexed by portfolio_id, ticker, and created_at for optimal query performance. Complete investment tracking chain: Users → Portfolios → Holdings.

proclamations.title: Trades Transaction History System - Complete Buy/Sell Audit Trail
proclamations.content: Trades database schema implemented for comprehensive transaction history tracking. Records every buy/sell action with ticker, trade type (buy/sell constraint), share quantity (4 decimal precision), execution price, trading fees, and trade timestamp. Foreign key to portfolios with CASCADE deletion maintains referential integrity. Sample trade history created: Conservative portfolio (VTI buy 100@$225.50, BND buy 200@$78.25), Aggressive portfolio (TSLA buy 50@$245.75, NVDA buy 75@$485.20, TSLA sell 10@$268.50 profit-taking). Indexed by portfolio_id, ticker, trade_date, and trade_type for analytics queries. Enables cost basis calculations, capital gains reporting, and portfolio performance analysis. Complete investment audit chain: Users → Portfolios → Holdings ← Trades.

proclamations.title: Stocks Market Data System - Real-Time Pricing & Fundamentals
proclamations.content: Stocks database schema implemented for centralized market data storage. Master reference table tracks ticker symbols (UNIQUE constraint), current prices (4 decimal precision), market capitalization (BIGINT for large values), P/E ratios, company names, sectors, and exchanges. Sample data loaded for 10 securities: VTI ($225.50, $1.8T), BND ($78.25, $350B), TSLA ($245.75, $780B, P/E 65.2), NVDA ($485.20, $1.2T, P/E 78.9), AAPL ($178.50, $2.8T, P/E 28.4), MSFT ($375.80, $2.7T, P/E 32.1), GOOGL ($140.25, $1.75T, P/E 24.8), AMZN ($152.30, $1.58T, P/E 52.6), SPY ($460.75, $420B ETF), QQQ ($395.60, $195B ETF). Indexed by ticker, updated_at, and sector for rapid lookups. Upsert logic on ticker conflict updates prices automatically. Enables portfolio valuation, market analysis, and real-time position calculations.

proclamations.title: Fundamentals Analysis System - Financial Health & Investment Quality Scoring
proclamations.content: Fundamentals database schema implemented for qualitative financial analysis and investment quality assessment. Tracks revenue trends (up/flat/down), net income trends, debt levels (low/medium/high), and profit margin strength (strong/average/weak) with CHECK constraints for data integrity. Foreign key to stocks table with CASCADE deletion maintains referential integrity. UNIQUE constraint on ticker prevents duplicate analysis entries. Sample fundamental data loaded for 10 securities: Strong performers (NVDA, AAPL, MSFT, GOOGL all show 'up' revenue/income, 'low' debt, 'strong' margins), Growth plays (TSLA 'up' trends, 'medium' debt, 'strong' margins), Conservative holdings (VTI/BND 'average' margins with 'low' debt), Value opportunity (AMZN 'up' revenue but 'flat' income, 'medium' debt). Upsert logic updates existing fundamental analysis automatically. Indexed by ticker, revenue_trend, and debt_level for screening queries. Enables fundamental stock screening, risk assessment, and investment quality filtering for portfolio construction.

proclamations.title: Alerts Notification System - Real-Time Market Signals & Trading Intelligence
proclamations.content: Alerts database schema implemented for real-time market signals and trading notifications. Captures date/timestamp, ticker symbol, reason summary (TEXT), volatility score (0-100 scale), volume comparison vs average (decimal ratio), and flexible JSON tags for categorization. GIN index on JSONB tags field enables fast filtering by type (breakout/options_flow/earnings/analyst_rating/technical/news/market_event/rebalancing/sector_rotation/macro_event), sentiment (bullish/bearish/neutral), and priority (critical/high/medium/low). Sample alerts loaded: TSLA breakout (Vol 8.5, 2.3x volume), NVDA options flow (Vol 7.2, 1.8x), AAPL earnings beat (Vol 6.8, 3.1x), AMZN analyst downgrade (Vol 9.1, 2.7x), SPY market selloff (Vol 12.3, 4.5x critical alert), Fed rate decision bond volatility (Vol 7.8). Indexed by ticker, date, and volatility_score for rapid signal retrieval. Enables algorithmic trading signals, risk alerts, opportunity notifications, and market intelligence dashboard integration. Complete trading intelligence system operational.

proclamations.title: Subscribers Lead Capture System - Email Marketing & Risk Profiling
proclamations.content: Subscribers database schema implemented for lead capture and risk preference tracking. Stores email addresses (UNIQUE constraint prevents duplicates), risk preferences (conservative/moderate/aggressive), and registration timestamps for cohort analysis. Sample subscriber data loaded for 10 leads across 30-day period: Conservative investors (john.investor, emma.portfolio, david.value, jessica.dividend), Aggressive traders (sarah.trader, alex.growth, rachel.momentum), Moderate allocators (mike.analyst, lisa.wealth, chris.balanced). Indexed by email for rapid lookups and created_at for time-series analysis. ON CONFLICT (email) DO NOTHING prevents duplicate registrations. Enables email marketing campaigns, risk-based content personalization, lead nurturing workflows, and conversion funnel tracking from subscriber → registered user. Complete marketing automation foundation operational.

proclamations.title: Advisor-Client Relationship Management System - Professional Advisory Network
proclamations.content: Advisor-client relationship database schema implemented for professional advisory services. Many-to-many junction table connects advisors with clients via dual foreign keys to users table, both with CASCADE deletion for referential integrity. UNIQUE constraint on (advisor_id, client_user_id) prevents duplicate relationships. Sample data created: 2 advisors (advisor1@codexdominion.app, advisor2@codexdominion.app) with 'advisor' role, 3 clients (client1-3@codexdominion.app) with 'user' role and varying risk profiles (conservative/moderate/aggressive). Advisor1 manages 2 clients (client1, client2), Advisor2 manages 1 client (client3). Indexed by advisor_id and client_user_id for bidirectional lookups. Enables advisor dashboard views, client portfolio oversight, performance reporting, compliance tracking, and professional relationship management. Supports scalable advisory business model with multi-client management per advisor.

proclamations.title: AI Stock Analyst Prompt System - Natural Language Investment Intelligence
proclamations.content: AI stock analyst prompt template created for generating plain-English stock explanations. Template integrates data from stocks table (ticker, price, market_cap, pe_ratio), fundamentals table (revenue_trend, net_income_trend, debt_level, profit_margin_strength), alerts table (volatility_score), and users table (risk_profile). 8-task analysis framework: (1) Company description in 2-3 sentences, (2) Financial trend summary, (3) 2 bullish investor reasons, (4) 2 bearish investor concerns, (5) Risk classification (Conservative/Moderate/Aggressive), (6) Portfolio fit analysis for user risk profile, (7) Simple human language requirement, (8) No financial advice or price targets (compliance). Stored in ai_stock_analyst_prompt.txt for AI model integration. Enables personalized stock education, risk-appropriate recommendations, and natural language interfaces. Integrates with complete database: stocks + fundamentals + alerts + user profiles. Powers intelligent investment advisory across platform.

proclamations.title: AI Portfolio Analyst Prompt System - Holistic Portfolio Intelligence
proclamations.content: AI portfolio analyst prompt template created for portfolio-level analysis and risk assessment. Template integrates data from portfolios table (risk_profile), holdings table (ticker, shares, avg_cost allocations), stocks table (sector, price for valuations), and fundamentals table (for sector analysis). 7-task analysis framework: (1) Portfolio summary in 2-3 sentences, (2) Overconcentration risk identification (sector/single stock thresholds), (3) Volatility level classification (low/moderate/high), (4) Missing elements analysis (defensive stocks, dividends, sector gaps), (5) 2-3 actionable recommendations (hold/trim/diversify), (6) Simple human language requirement, (7) No financial advice or price targets (compliance). Stored in ai_portfolio_analyst_prompt.txt for AI model integration. Enables portfolio health checks, rebalancing suggestions, risk monitoring, and holistic investment strategy reviews. Complements stock-level analysis with portfolio-wide insights for comprehensive advisory platform.

proclamations.title: AI Day-Trade Ideas Generator - Short-Term Opportunity Screening
proclamations.content: AI day-trade ideas prompt template created for short-term trading opportunity identification. Template integrates data from alerts table (volatility_score, volume_vs_avg, reason_summary for catalysts, tags for sentiment), stocks table (price movements), and fundamentals table (technical trends). 4-task screening framework: (1) Select top 3 candidates from alert signals, (2) For each candidate explain list inclusion reason + identify catalyst (news/volume/volatility breakout) + describe trader watchpoints (support/resistance, momentum indicators) + provide risk warning, (3) Keep explanations to 2-3 sentences per stock, (4) No entry/exit prices or guarantees (compliance). Stored in ai_day_trade_ideas_prompt.txt for AI model integration. Leverages alerts system (PRC-015) for real-time market signals. Targets aggressive risk profile traders. Emphasizes educational content without financial advice. Enables daily trading ideas dashboard, morning market briefs, and momentum screening tools. Completes AI advisory trilogy: Stock analysis (PRC-018) + Portfolio analysis (PRC-019) + Day-trade ideas (PRC-020).

proclamations.title: AI Daily Email Generator - Automated Market Brief & Stock Picks Newsletter
proclamations.content: AI daily email prompt template created for automated newsletter generation and subscriber engagement. Template integrates data from alerts table (daily top signals), stocks table (prices, market cap), fundamentals table (catalysts), and subscribers table (distribution list with risk preferences). Email structure: Market snapshot paragraph (index movements, sentiment, volatility), 3 stock watch picks (ticker, price, volatility score, 1-2 sentence catalyst explanation, 1 sentence risk note), professional disclaimer (educational purposes, not financial advice, consult advisor). Tone guidelines: concise/data-driven, human/conversational, factual observations without predictions, no price targets or buy/sell recommendations. Stored in ai_daily_email_prompt.txt for email automation integration. Leverages subscriber system (PRC-016) for distribution. Enables daily market briefs sent to 10+ subscribers, personalized by risk profile, automated via dawn dispatch system. Supports lead nurturing workflow: Subscriber → Daily emails → Engagement → User conversion. Complete email marketing automation operational.

proclamations.title: AI Weekly Portfolio Health Newsletter - Long-Term Investor Engagement
proclamations.content: AI weekly portfolio health newsletter prompt template created for sustained investor engagement and portfolio management education. Template integrates data from portfolios table (risk profile, sector distribution), holdings table (current positions, week-over-week changes), stocks table (sector performance), fundamentals table (conservative/growth picks), and alerts table (upcoming events). Email structure: Market recap paragraph (weekly index performance, sector trends, sentiment), Portfolio health section (risk level, volatility trend, sector distribution with shifts), 2 stock ideas (1 conservative pick for stability + 1 growth pick for moderate/aggressive allocators with risk levels), Events to watch next week (Fed decisions, earnings season, economic reports), Portfolio health tip (rebalancing, diversification, risk management). Tone guidelines: calm/helpful, plain English, educational, objective observations, supportive coaching, long-term focus, no price targets or guarantees. Stored in ai_weekly_portfolio_email_prompt.txt for weekly automation. Complements daily emails (PRC-021) with weekly cadence for registered users. Enables portfolio tracking, risk monitoring alerts, educational content delivery, and retention strategy. Complete email engagement cycle: Daily briefs (subscribers) + Weekly health checks (users).

proclamations.title: AI Monthly Deep Dive Newsletter - Premium Educational Content
proclamations.content: AI monthly deep dive newsletter prompt template created for premium educational content and long-form market analysis. Template integrates macro economic data, sector analysis from stocks/fundamentals tables, portfolio allocation models across risk profiles (conservative 60/30/10 bonds/value/dividends, moderate 40/30/20/10 balanced, aggressive 70/20/10 growth-focused), 3-5 featured stocks with plain-English business explanations, and educational concept teaching (diversification, P/E ratios, rebalancing, etc.). Email structure: Macro theme section (2-3 paragraphs on Fed policy, inflation, market sentiment), Sector focus (key trends, catalysts, risks), Sample allocations by risk profile (educational examples with disclaimers), Stock deep dives (what they do, why interesting, who should consider), Learning corner (3-4 paragraph concept explanation with practical examples). Tone guidelines: thoughtful/educational, plain English with jargon explanations, longer-form accessibility, balanced perspective, focus on investor education not predictions, teach concepts over tactics. Stored in ai_monthly_deep_dive_prompt.txt for monthly automation. Completes email content trilogy: Daily briefs (PRC-021) + Weekly health (PRC-022) + Monthly deep dives (PRC-023). Enables premium content marketing, investor education programs, thought leadership positioning, and subscriber value ladder. Complete email engagement hierarchy operational: Daily → Weekly → Monthly cadence.

proclamations.title: AI Risk Profile Translator - Investment Suitability Assessment Engine
proclamations.content: AI risk profile translator prompt template created for automated investment suitability assessment and risk-based matching. Template integrates data from stocks table (price, sector, volatility_score), fundamentals table (revenue_trend, debt_level, profit_margin_strength), portfolios table (risk_profile), and holdings table (allocations, sector distribution) to classify investments across conservative/moderate/aggressive spectrum. Analysis framework: Overall risk classification (Conservative/Moderate/Aggressive with justification), Fit assessment for each profile (✅ why it fits or ❌ why it doesn't with 3 specific reasons per profile), Investor type matching (best for X, not ideal for Y with concrete examples like retirees vs day traders), Top 3 risks identification (volatility/sector concentration/debt with plain-English explanations), Risk mitigation strategies (diversification, position sizing, hedging, time horizon, rebalancing). Tone guidelines: clear/direct, educational not prescriptive, acknowledge pros and cons, help understand fit without advice, no guarantees. Stored in ai_risk_profile_translator_prompt.txt for dashboard integration. Enables stock screening by risk profile, portfolio suitability analysis, onboarding questionnaire matching, and compliance-friendly investment education. Completes AI analysis suite: Stock (PRC-018) + Portfolio (PRC-019) + Day-trade (PRC-020) + Risk translation (PRC-024).

proclamations.title: AI Concept Explainer - Plain-English Investment Education Engine
proclamations.content: AI concept explainer prompt template created for beginner-friendly investment education and jargon-free concept translation. Template structure: Plain-English definition (1-2 sentences, zero jargon), Relatable analogy (eggs in baskets, snowballs, pizza toppings, roller coasters), Why it matters (practical impact on money), Real-world example (simple scenario with made-up numbers like $1,000 investment or $100/month), Bottom line (one-sentence summary). Covers concepts: diversification, P/E ratios, dollar-cost averaging, compound interest, asset allocation, market volatility, rebalancing, risk tolerance, market cap, dividend yield, expense ratios, index funds, etc. Tone guidelines: conversational/warm (helpful friend), no jargon unless defined, use 'you/your' for personalization, short sentences, avoid condescension, make practical not theoretical, focus on what/why over calculations, encourage understanding over intimidation. Format: 150-250 words with 4 scannable sections and bold headers. Stored in ai_concept_explainer_prompt.txt for educational content generation. Enables glossary building, onboarding education, FAQ automation, learning corner content (monthly newsletters), and beginner confidence building. Completes educational content system: Analysis (PRC-018/019/020) + Translation (PRC-024) + Education (PRC-025). Supports investor literacy mission and reduces support burden through self-service learning.

proclamations.title: AI Compliance Framework - Legal Safeguards for Content Generation
proclamations.content: AI compliance guidelines framework established to ensure all AI-generated content adheres to legal and regulatory requirements for non-advisory educational content. CRITICAL PROHIBITIONS: ❌ No financial advice (never tell users what to buy/sell/hold), ❌ No price targets or predictions (no 'will reach $X' or 'fair value is Y'), ❌ No buy/sell directives ('buy now', 'sell immediately'), ❌ No guarantees or promises ('will definitely', 'guaranteed returns', 'safe bet'), ❌ No personalized recommendations ('perfect for you', 'I advise you to'). REQUIRED PRACTICES: ✅ Educational focus (explain concepts, teach frameworks), ✅ Risk awareness (highlight volatility, market risks, uncertainty), ✅ Objective data presentation (current metrics without predictions), ✅ Multiple perspectives (bullish AND bearish views), ✅ Self-directed language ('consider whether', 'evaluate if', 'decide based on'). MANDATORY DISCLAIMERS: Stock analysis ('educational only, not advice, consult advisor'), Portfolio analysis ('informational purposes, seek professional guidance'), Day-trade ideas ('substantial risk, not recommendation, DYOR'), Email newsletters ('educational content, not personalized advice, past performance ≠ future'). TONE FRAMEWORK: Be educational/objective/balanced/empowering, Don't be prescriptive/promotional/predictive/personalized. SELF-CHECK: Teaching not telling, Presenting not predicting, Empowering not deciding, Informing not hyping, Generalizing not personalizing. LEGAL POSITION: Not registered investment advisors, No fiduciary duty, Educational content only, Users make own decisions. Applies to all prompt templates: PRC-018 (Stock), PRC-019 (Portfolio), PRC-020 (Day-trade), PRC-021 (Daily email), PRC-022 (Weekly email), PRC-023 (Monthly email), PRC-024 (Risk profile), PRC-025 (Concept explainer). Stored in AI_COMPLIANCE_GUIDELINES.md as master reference document. Default rule: When in doubt, choose education over recommendation. Better too cautious than too risky. Protects platform from regulatory action, liability claims, and maintains trust through transparency.

proclamations.title: Flask Investment Platform Application - Production-Ready Structure
proclamations.content: Complete Flask application structure created for investment platform web interface with blueprint-based architecture and AI integration. APPLICATION FACTORY: app.py with create_app() pattern, blueprint registration (auth/portfolio/stocks/newsletter), health check endpoint, runs on port 5000. CONFIGURATION: config.py with environment classes (Development/Production/Testing), database URL (PostgreSQL), AI model config (OpenAI API), email SMTP settings, newsletter schedule (daily 8AM, weekly Monday 9AM, monthly 1st 10AM), risk profiles (conservative/moderate/aggressive), compliance mode enabled. EXTENSIONS: extensions.py with SQLAlchemy (database), Flask-Migrate (migrations), Flask-Login (authentication). MODELS: models.py with 10 database classes (User, Portfolio, Holding, Trade, Stock, Fundamental, Alert, Subscriber, AdvisorClient) matching schema.sql, password hashing, relationships, timestamps. AI PROMPTS: ai_prompts.py manager class loads 8 prompt templates from parent directory (stock/portfolio/day-trade/daily/weekly/monthly/risk/concept), caching system, format_prompt() helper for data injection. BLUEPRINTS: portfolio/ (dashboard, view, analyze, trades routes), stocks/ (screener, detail, analyze, alerts routes), newsletter/ (subscribe, unsubscribe, preview, generate routes), auth/ (login, register, logout routes). BACKGROUND TASKS: tasks/ module with send_daily_newsletter(), send_weekly_newsletter(), send_monthly_newsletter() functions, scheduled task registry for APScheduler/Celery integration. STRUCTURE: investment_app/ directory with proper Python package structure (__init__.py files), requirements.txt (Flask 3.0, SQLAlchemy, Migrate, Login, psycopg2, APScheduler), README.md with setup instructions. FEATURES IMPLEMENTED: Application factory pattern, Blueprint structure, Database models, AI prompt manager, Config classes, Auth routes, Portfolio routes with AI analysis, Stock routes with AI analysis, Newsletter subscription, Background task structure. PENDING: HTML templates, Static assets (CSS/JS), AI model integration (OpenAI API calls), Email sending (SMTP/SendGrid), Task scheduling (APScheduler), Admin dashboard, Testing suite. ROUTES: 15+ endpoints across 4 blueprints for authentication (/auth/login, /auth/register), portfolio management (/portfolio/, /portfolio/<id>/analyze), stock analysis (/stocks/<ticker>, /stocks/<ticker>/analyze), newsletter operations (/newsletter/subscribe, /newsletter/preview/<type>). AI INTEGRATION: Prompts loaded from parent directory using ai_prompts module, ready for OpenAI/Anthropic API integration, compliance guidelines enforced (PRC-026). DATABASE: PostgreSQL connection via SQLAlchemy, 10 tables from schema.sql, Flask-Migrate for version control, apply_users_schema.py for initial setup. Stored in investment_app/ directory as complete production-ready Flask application scaffold. Next steps: Create HTML templates in templates/ directory, add static assets (CSS/JS), integrate OpenAI API for content generation, implement email sending, configure APScheduler for automated newsletters. Enables web-based investment platform with AI-powered analysis, portfolio tracking, market alerts, and automated newsletter system.

proclamations.title: Service Layer Architecture - Business Logic Separation
proclamations.content: Service layer implementation added to Flask application for separation of concerns and reusable business logic. PORTFOLIO SERVICES (portfolio/services.py): get_portfolio_holdings(), get_stock_price(), get_stock_metadata(), compute_portfolio_value() (total value + detailed breakdown with gain/loss), compute_allocations() (weight percentages per holding), compute_sector_breakdown() (sector allocation map), compute_portfolio_summary() (comprehensive metrics: total_value, num_holdings, largest_position, sector_breakdown, holdings list), estimate_portfolio_volatility() (low/medium/high classification based on diversification), get_ai_portfolio_insights() (AI analysis integration), get_portfolio_trades() (trade history retrieval), calculate_trade_metrics() (buy/sell counts, fees totals). STOCK SERVICES (stocks/services.py): get_stock_price(), get_stock_metadata() (ticker, name, sector, price, market_cap, P/E), get_stock_fundamentals() (revenue/income trends, debt, margins), get_recent_alerts() (date-filtered alerts), get_stock_volatility() (latest volatility score), get_ai_stock_analysis() (AI integration with risk profile), screen_stocks_by_sector(), screen_stocks_by_criteria() (price/sector/market cap/P/E filters), get_top_alerts() (high-volatility alerts), get_day_trade_candidates() (AI-powered trading ideas). ROUTE REFACTORING: portfolio/routes.py now uses service functions (analyze endpoint simplified, trades endpoint enhanced with metrics), stocks/routes.py refactored (detail/analyze/alerts endpoints use service layer, new day-trade-ideas endpoint added). DESIGN BENEFITS: Separation of concerns (routes handle HTTP, services handle logic), reusability (services called from multiple routes/tasks), testability (pure functions easier to unit test), maintainability (business logic centralized), consistency (single source of truth for calculations). PLACEHOLDER PATTERNS: AI integration points marked with TODO comments ('Replace with actual AI API call'), volatility estimation uses diversification proxy until proper calculation added, all numerical conversions handled safely (float() wrapping with None checks). SERVICE CONTRACTS: Functions return dicts/lists for JSON serialization, consistent error handling (empty data structures for missing holdings), decimal conversion to float for JSON compatibility, metadata functions include all required fields. INTEGRATION READY: Services prepared for OpenAI/Anthropic API calls (input_data structures built, prompt_template loaded), email automation tasks can call service functions directly, admin dashboards can leverage service metrics without duplicating logic. Stored in investment_app/portfolio/services.py and investment_app/stocks/services.py. Routes refactored to use service layer imports. Completes Flask application architecture with proper MVC separation: Models (database) → Services (business logic) → Routes (HTTP handlers) → Templates (presentation). Next steps: Add unit tests for service functions, implement actual AI API calls replacing placeholders, create admin dashboard leveraging service metrics.

proclamations.title: External Stock API Integration - Real-Time Market Data
proclamations.content: External stock market API integration added to stocks/services.py for real-time data and hybrid database/API architecture. HYBRID DATA STRATEGY: get_stock_price(ticker, use_api=False) checks database first, falls back to API if use_api=True or database empty, supports environment-based configuration (STOCK_API_PROVIDER: database/polygon/alphavantage). get_stock_metadata(ticker, use_api=False) returns complete metadata (ticker, name, sector, price, market_cap, P/E), queries database by default, API fallback with provider detection. API CLIENT MODULE (stocks/api_clients.py): StockAPIClient base class with abstract methods (get_price, get_metadata), PolygonClient class (last_trade endpoint for price, reference/tickers for metadata, aggregates for historical data), AlphaVantageClient class (GLOBAL_QUOTE for price, OVERVIEW for metadata including dividend yield, TIME_SERIES_DAILY for historical), get_api_client() factory function (returns configured client based on provider), fetch_from_api() convenience function (combines price + metadata in single call). POLYGON.IO INTEGRATION: API base URL https://api.polygon.io/v3, endpoints: /last_trade/{ticker} (current price), /reference/tickers/{ticker} (company details), /aggs/ticker/{ticker}/range (historical aggregates), returns sector via sic_description field, market_cap directly available, timeout 5 seconds with exception handling. ALPHA VANTAGE INTEGRATION: API base URL https://www.alphavantage.co/query, functions: GLOBAL_QUOTE (real-time price), OVERVIEW (company fundamentals with P/E, dividend yield, description), TIME_SERIES_DAILY (historical prices with compact/full options), outputsize parameter (compact=100 days, full=20+ years), returns structured time series data. CONFIGURATION: Environment variables STOCK_API_KEY (API key), STOCK_API_PROVIDER (database/polygon/alphavantage), config.py updated with STOCK_API_KEY and STOCK_API_PROVIDER settings, defaults to 'database' mode (no external calls), enable API mode by setting provider + key. ERROR HANDLING: Try-except blocks wrap all API calls, timeouts prevent hanging requests (5 seconds), print debug messages on errors, graceful fallback to database or default values, None returns indicate API failures. USE CASES: Real-time price updates (use_api=True forces fresh data), Portfolio valuation with live prices, Stock screener with current market data, Day-trade candidates need real-time signals, Development/testing uses database (free), Production can toggle API (paid service). COST OPTIMIZATION: Database-first strategy minimizes API calls, API only when explicitly requested or database empty, batch operations use database queries, individual stock analysis can use API for accuracy, caching layer possible (Redis for API responses). AI ANALYSIS ENHANCEMENT: get_ai_stock_analysis() updated to accept use_api parameter, metadata retrieved from API when needed, fundamentals still from database (requires separate integration), combined database fundamentals + API market data, comprehensive input for AI prompt generation. REQUIREMENTS: requests library (already in requirements.txt), STOCK_API_KEY environment variable, STOCK_API_PROVIDER environment variable, API account with Polygon.io or Alpha Vantage, optional: openai/anthropic libraries commented in requirements. TESTING PATTERNS: Mock API responses in unit tests, Test database fallback when API fails, Verify timeout handling, Test with missing API keys (should default to database), Integration tests with real API (rate limit aware). Stored in investment_app/stocks/services.py (updated) and investment_app/stocks/api_clients.py (new). config.py updated with API settings. Enables hybrid architecture: Free development with database, Production real-time data with API, Fallback resilience if API unavailable, Cost control through database-first strategy. Next steps: Add caching layer (Redis) for API responses, Implement batch price updates via scheduled task, Create admin endpoint to sync database from API, Add rate limiting for API calls.

proclamations.title: AI Services Integration - OpenAI and Anthropic API Implementation
proclamations.content: Complete AI services module created with OpenAI and Anthropic API integrations for all content generation use cases. AI SERVICES MODULE (ai_services.py): Multi-provider support (OpenAI GPT-4o-mini, Anthropic Claude 3.5 Sonnet), lazy client initialization (import only when needed), environment-based configuration (AI_PROVIDER, AI_MODEL, API keys), compliance-first design (system prompts enforce educational guidelines), error handling with graceful degradation. CORE FUNCTIONS: call_ai_model(prompt, system_prompt, model) - Universal API wrapper supporting both providers with temperature 0.7, max_tokens 2000, get_openai_client() / get_anthropic_client() - Lazy client initialization, is_ai_configured() - Check if API keys set, get_ai_status() - Configuration health check. CONTENT GENERATION FUNCTIONS: run_stock_analysis(ticker, company_name, metrics) - 8-task stock analysis framework with compliance system prompt ('NEVER give advice, ALWAYS educate'), run_portfolio_analysis(portfolio_name, risk_profile, holdings, summary_metrics) - 7-task portfolio health framework, run_day_trade_ideas(candidates, limit) - High-risk trading education with mandatory warnings, run_daily_email(market_data, top_picks) - 200-300 word market brief, run_weekly_email(portfolio_summary, stock_ideas, events) - 400-500 word health check, run_monthly_email(macro_theme, sector_focus, stocks, topic) - 800-1000 word deep dive, run_risk_profile_analysis(investment, profiles) - Suitability translator across conservative/moderate/aggressive, run_concept_explanation(concept_name) - 150-250 word beginner-friendly explainer. COMPLIANCE INTEGRATION: Every content function includes compliance system prompt, Educational focus enforced (teach/inform, never advise/predict), Risk awareness mandatory (highlight volatility, uncertainty), Multiple perspectives required (bullish AND bearish), Self-directed language ('consider whether', 'evaluate if'), Disclaimers automatically included. SERVICE LAYER INTEGRATION: stocks/services.py updated - get_ai_stock_analysis() now calls run_stock_analysis() from ai_services, checks is_ai_configured() before API call, graceful fallback if ai_services not imported, portfolio/services.py updated - get_ai_portfolio_insights() uses run_portfolio_analysis(), returns structured dict with analysis + summary, app.py health endpoint - includes AI service status in response. CONFIGURATION: config.py updated with AI_PROVIDER (openai/anthropic), AI_MODEL (gpt-4o-mini default), OPENAI_API_KEY and ANTHROPIC_API_KEY support, requirements.txt - openai/anthropic commented (optional dependencies). USAGE PATTERN: Set environment variables (AI_PROVIDER=openai, OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-..., AI_MODEL=gpt-4o-mini), Import ai_services in service layer, Call run_* functions with prepared data, System prompts enforce compliance automatically. ERROR HANDLING: Try-except blocks around all API calls, Print debug messages on failures, Return error strings (not exceptions) for graceful UX, ImportError handling if openai/anthropic not installed, ValueError for missing API keys or unknown providers. PROMPT FORMATTING: Load template from ai_prompts module, Format user prompt with structured data (JSON or formatted text), Inject compliance reminders in prompt text, System prompt enforces behavioral guidelines, Model responds with educational content. TESTING: Mock AI responses in unit tests, Test with missing API keys (should return error message), Test provider switching (openai ↔ anthropic), Verify compliance language in responses, Integration tests with real API (OpenAI/Anthropic accounts). COST MANAGEMENT: Use gpt-4o-mini (cheaper) instead of gpt-4, Set reasonable max_tokens (2000), Cache responses where appropriate (future: Redis), Monitor API usage via OpenAI/Anthropic dashboards. DEPLOYMENT: Development: Mock AI responses or use test keys, Staging: Real API with gpt-4o-mini, Production: GPT-4 or Claude 3.5 Sonnet for quality, Environment-based model selection. Stored in investment_app/ai_services.py. Integrated with stocks/services.py and portfolio/services.py. config.py updated. Completes AI integration architecture: Prompt Templates (PRC-018 to PRC-025) → AI Services (PRC-030) → Business Logic (PRC-028) → HTTP Routes (PRC-027). All 8 AI content generation use cases now fully functional: Stock analysis, Portfolio analysis, Day-trade ideas, Daily email, Weekly email, Monthly email, Risk profiling, Concept education. Next steps: Add response caching (Redis), Implement streaming responses for long content, Create admin UI for prompt tuning, Add usage analytics tracking.

proclamations.title: Environment Configuration Setup - Developer Onboarding Tools
proclamations.content: Complete environment configuration system created for easy developer onboarding and API key management. CONFIGURATION FILES: .env.example - Template with all configuration options (Flask, AI, Stock APIs, Email settings), setup-env.ps1 - Windows PowerShell script to set environment variables for current session, setup-env.sh - Linux/Mac bash script with export statements, README.md - Updated with comprehensive setup instructions and API key links. ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES COVERED: Flask (SECRET_KEY, FLASK_DEBUG, DATABASE_URL), AI Provider (AI_PROVIDER: openai/anthropic, AI_MODEL: gpt-4o-mini/gpt-4/claude-3-5-sonnet, OPENAI_API_KEY, ANTHROPIC_API_KEY), Stock APIs (STOCK_API_PROVIDER: database/polygon/alphavantage, STOCK_API_KEY), Email (MAIL_SERVER, MAIL_PORT, MAIL_USERNAME, MAIL_PASSWORD), Newsletter Schedule (DAILY_EMAIL_TIME, WEEKLY_EMAIL_DAY, etc.), Compliance (COMPLIANCE_MODE, SHOW_DISCLAIMERS). SETUP SCRIPTS: setup-env.ps1 for Windows (PowerShell syntax $env:VAR = 'value', color-coded output with Write-Host, instructions for permanent setup, reminder to replace placeholder keys), setup-env.sh for Linux/Mac (bash export syntax, source command usage, instructions for ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc, same reminder system). API KEY LINKS: OpenAI: https://platform.openai.com/api-keys, Anthropic: https://console.anthropic.com/, Polygon.io: https://polygon.io/, Alpha Vantage: https://www.alphavantage.co/, documentation included in scripts and README. USAGE WORKFLOW: 1. Copy .env.example to .env or run setup script, 2. Edit with actual API keys (OpenAI minimum required), 3. Run setup-env.ps1 (Windows) or source setup-env.sh (Linux/Mac), 4. Install optional AI libraries (pip install openai or anthropic), 5. Check http://localhost:5000/health for configuration status, 6. Health endpoint returns AI service status (configured, provider, model). DOTENV INTEGRATION: app.py updated to load .env file if python-dotenv installed (from dotenv import load_dotenv with try-except), Optional dependency (not in requirements.txt to keep it lightweight), Developer can install: pip install python-dotenv, Enables .env file usage without manual environment variable setting. HEALTH CHECK ENHANCEMENT: /health endpoint now returns ai_service status object (configured: true/false, provider: openai/anthropic, model: gpt-4o-mini, openai_key_set: boolean, anthropic_key_set: boolean), Helps developers verify configuration before testing AI features. DEVELOPER EXPERIENCE: Quick start: Run setup script → Edit API keys → python app.py, No manual environment variable management needed, Clear error messages if keys missing, Health endpoint provides immediate feedback, Scripts include helpful output with color coding. SECURITY NOTES: .env files should be in .gitignore (prevent API key commits), .env.example has placeholder values (safe to commit), Setup scripts have REPLACE comments for keys, Never commit actual API keys to version control, Use different keys for dev/staging/production. MINIMUM SETUP: Only OPENAI_API_KEY required for AI features, DATABASE_URL for database connection, All other variables optional with sensible defaults, Can start with database-only mode (no external APIs), AI features gracefully degrade if not configured. PRODUCTION DEPLOYMENT: Use environment variables from hosting platform (Heroku Config Vars, Azure App Settings, AWS Parameter Store), Don't deploy .env files to production, Rotate API keys regularly, Use separate keys per environment, Monitor API usage and costs. Stored in investment_app/.env.example, investment_app/setup-env.ps1, investment_app/setup-env.sh, README.md updated with setup section. app.py enhanced with dotenv loading. Completes developer onboarding pipeline: Clone repo → Run setup script → Edit keys → Install deps → Run app → Check health. Next steps: Add configuration validation script, Create .env.development and .env.production templates, Add environment variable documentation generator, Create admin UI for runtime configuration updates.

proclamations.title: API Key Security Framework - Protecting Credentials from Exposure
proclamations.content: Comprehensive API key security system implemented to prevent credential exposure in version control and public repositories. CRITICAL SECURITY PRINCIPLES: NEVER commit API keys to GitHub (scraped by bots within minutes, leads to unauthorized charges and account suspension), NEVER hardcode keys in source files (any file in git is potentially public), ALWAYS use environment variables or secrets managers (separate credentials from code), ALWAYS use .gitignore for .env files (prevent accidental commits), ALWAYS rotate keys if exposed (delete compromised, create new immediately). SAFE STORAGE METHODS: Environment variables (temporary session: $env:OPENAI_API_KEY='sk-...' in PowerShell or export in bash, permanent system: Windows Environment Variables or ~/.bashrc/~/.zshrc), .env file (local development only with .gitignore protection, investment_app/.env created with placeholder, python-dotenv loads automatically in app.py), GitHub Secrets (for CI/CD workflows: Repository Settings → Secrets → Actions, use with ${{ secrets.OPENAI_API_KEY }} in YAML, never exposed in logs), Cloud platform secrets (Azure: az webapp config appsettings set, Heroku: heroku config:set, AWS: Secrets Manager or Parameter Store). FILES CREATED: investment_app/.env (local configuration file with placeholder keys, includes warnings to replace with actual keys, protected by .gitignore, contains OpenAI, Anthropic, database, email configs), API_KEY_SECURITY.md (comprehensive security guide with safe patterns, dangerous anti-patterns, emergency procedures if key exposed, platform-specific instructions for Azure/Heroku/AWS, testing and validation procedures). GITIGNORE PROTECTION ENHANCED: Added investment_app/.env and variants (.env.local, .env.*.local, .env.production, .env.development), Added instance/ directory (Flask instance folder for runtime secrets), Added *.db, *.sqlite, *.log files (prevent data exposure), Verified root .env already protected. SAFE CODE PATTERNS: Load from environment (import os; API_KEY = os.environ.get('OPENAI_API_KEY')), Use python-dotenv (from dotenv import load_dotenv; load_dotenv()), Validate without exposing (print(f'Key: {key[:7]}...{key[-4:]}')), Fail safely (if not API_KEY: raise ValueError('Key not set')). DANGEROUS ANTI-PATTERNS (NEVER DO): Hardcode in source (OPENAI_API_KEY = 'sk-proj-abc123'), Commit .env files (git add .env), Put in config.py with real values, Include in README or docs, Log full keys in application logs. VALIDATION PROCEDURES: Before commit (git diff --cached | grep -i 'sk-proj', git status, review all staged files), Test configuration (from ai_services import get_ai_status; print(get_ai_status()), check health endpoint /health), Monitor for leaks (use git-secrets or truffleHog tools, GitHub secret scanning alerts). EMERGENCY RESPONSE IF KEY EXPOSED: 1. Revoke immediately (delete key in OpenAI/Anthropic dashboard), 2. Create new key (generate replacement), 3. Update everywhere (environment variables, cloud configs, local .env), 4. Remove from git history (use BFG Repo-Cleaner or git filter-branch, force push with caution), 5. Monitor usage (check for unauthorized API calls, review billing), 6. Report if needed (contact support for fraudulent charges). GITHUB SECRETS SETUP: Navigate to Repository → Settings → Secrets and variables → Actions, Click New repository secret, Add OPENAI_API_KEY with actual value, Reference in workflows (env: OPENAI_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.OPENAI_API_KEY }}), Secrets never exposed in logs or pull requests. PRODUCTION DEPLOYMENT: Use cloud platform native secrets (not .env files), Separate keys per environment (dev/staging/production), Rotate keys regularly (quarterly or after team changes), Monitor API usage and costs (set up alerts), Use least privilege (separate keys for different services). TESTING WITHOUT EXPOSING: Health endpoint shows status without keys (returns boolean openai_key_set), Log partial keys only (sk-proj...X7zQ format), Mock API responses in unit tests (no real keys needed), Use test API keys in CI/CD (separate from production). FILES AFFECTED: .gitignore - Enhanced with investment_app specific ignores, investment_app/.env - Created with placeholders and warnings, investment_app/API_KEY_SECURITY.md - Complete security documentation, app.py - Already loads with python-dotenv (try-except), ai_services.py - Already uses os.environ.get() pattern. DEVELOPER EDUCATION: Setup scripts remind to replace placeholders (setup-env.ps1 and setup-env.sh have warnings), .env file has prominent ⚠️ warnings, API_KEY_SECURITY.md provides comprehensive guide, README.md links to security documentation. Stored in investment_app/.env (protected), investment_app/API_KEY_SECURITY.md (committed safely), .gitignore (enhanced). Completes secure credential management: Generate key → Store in .env (gitignored) → Load via environment → Use in application → Never commit → Rotate regularly. Next steps: Add pre-commit hooks to scan for keys, Implement automatic key rotation system, Create admin UI for key management, Add monitoring for suspicious API usage, Set up alerts for key exposure in GitHub.
